Topic.Title: My call of $45 by Friday close....

Message.Msg: I like your enthusiasm but $45 by Friday is a bit aggressive. However I do believe in the sequence of things to come. E3 is Monday, thus, Thursday and Fri we may have rallies that may bring this closer to $40. Then when Monday comes around and people actually have a chance to experience the Xbox One; the stock will rally some more to $40, then comes the investors conference on Tuesday where msft will disclose further plans for 2014 and beyond; we will get another rally into the rest of next week. We may see low $40's to $45 by the end of next week. $125 by July is very aggressive; I have 9k shares-- it would an injustice for me to make that much money in such a short time. But I do think Msft will hit $75 by xmas. And I promised myself already, if msft does not reach $50 by xmas; I will stop investing forever.

Message.Title: The rich are richer and the poor are poorer. Thank you Obama
Message.Msg: Columnist Charles Krauthammer on the “O’Reilly Factor” Tuesday night said the “biggest scandal of all” regarding the Benghazi attacks on Sept. 11, 2012, has yet to emerge. “I think there is a bigger story here, here’s the one that will in time come out,” Krauthammer said. ”The biggest scandal of all, the biggest question is: What was the president doing in those eight hours?” “He had a routine meeting at five o’clock. He never after, during the eight hours when our guys have their lives in danger, he never called the Secretary of Defense, he never calls the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs, he never calls the CIA Director,” Krauthammer continued. “Who does he call? About five hours in he calls the Secretary of State. And after the phone call she releases a statement essentially about the video and how we denounce any intolerance. It looks as if the only phone call was to construct a cover story at a time when the last two Americans who died were still alive and fighting for their lives. There’s the scandal and that has to be uncovered.”

Message.Title: Sorry wrong past. The Rich are getting richer according to Steve Rattner
Message.Msg: Recommend Twitter Linkedin Sign In to E-Mail Print Reprints Share . NEW statistics show an ever-more-startling divergence between the fortunes of the wealthy and everybody else — and the desperate need to address this wrenching problem. Even in a country that sometimes seems inured to income inequality, these takeaways are truly stunning. Multimedia Graphic . Related News Economic Scene: Inequality Undermines Democracy (March 21, 2012) In 2010, as the nation continued to recover from the recession, a dizzying 93 percent of the additional income created in the country that year, compared to 2009 — $288 billion — went to the top 1 percent of taxpayers, those with at least $352,000 in income. That delivered an average single-year pay increase of 11.6 percent to each of these households. Still more astonishing was the extent to which the super rich got rich faster than the merely rich. In 2010, 37 percent of these additional earnings went to just the top 0.01 percent, a teaspoon-size collection of about 15,000 households with average incomes of $23.8 million. These fortunate few saw their incomes rise by 21.5 percent. The bottom 99 percent received a microscopic $80 increase in pay per person in 2010, after adjusting for inflation. The top 1 percent, whose average income is $1,019,089, had an 11.6 percent increase in income.

Topic.Title: Left Wing also are more concerned about maintaing S.S. and Medicare for themselves

Message.Msg: By KEVIN CIRILLI | 5/30/13 6:40 AM EDT President Barack Obama’s approval rating took a hit amid three controversies surrounding his administration, including an investigation into the Internal Revenue Service unfairly targeting conservative groups seeking nonprofit status, a new poll Thursday showed. Obama has a 45 percent approval rating and a 49 percent disapproval rating — compared with a 48 percent approval, 45 percent disapproval rating from May 1, according to the Quinnipiac University poll. In particular, Obama plunged among independent voters. Only 37 percent of independents approve of him while 57 percent disapprove, Quinnipiac found. At the start of the month, 42 percent of independents approved and 48 percent disapproved. Nine percent of GOPers approve of Obama, 86 percent disapprove. Among Democrats, 87 percent approve, 8 percent disapprove.

Topic.Title: Folks MSFT is up because the Fed has been pumping them to support the DOW

Message.Msg: Oh gawd, how many x must I explain Level 2 Stock Quotes to you? My trading platform presents tic x tic, minute, 5 minute, 15 minute, and any other time frame I want and when a trading opportunity forms, then, and only then, do I call up level2 so I can route my order to the market maker offering the best price. Daytraders usually have 4 time frame charts running on 1 stock so any TA trade that comes along is detected and then trade action is taken by calling up level2. When I call up level2 the decision to trade has already been made. The only thing left is to get the best price and just throwing out a market order is not getting the best price. By routing a order you can usually save .01 going and coming and making 1000's of trades a year, that can add up I will admit there is a possibility of seeing a market maker offering a oddball price, but that will have been detected with RT charts, so why "watch " level2? It won't tell you if a stock is breaking out of a channel or any other TA indicator. I put in simple to you, level2 is used to route your order to the best price offered. Once the trade is confirmed there is no need for level2 until the next trade decision has been reached. I would suggest you lurk a rt chat room for a few years then report back here.

Message.Title: How the Fed rigs the Market under Obama for gullible suc**rs like pepeekook
Message.Msg: The mechanism was put in place by REagan, Obama and Bernanke are openly abusing the mechanism for a non intended purpose, another case of overreach and abuse of power by big government. It's not that far removed from the jobs of the olde "floor specialists" except that they defended at support levels, Bernanke is pumping, then defending the pumped up inflated price. It will explode but the pockets are deep and it will require a trigger to get volume moving. Synopsis There are just four people who control all of the U.S. markets through their use of dangerous and explosive DERIVATIVES. They are risking the assets and retirement funds of all Americans. This group is known among Wall Street as the Plunge Protection Team (PPT). Their "official" INTENDED role was to prevent another 1987 "Black Monday". They have the entire U.S. Treasury at their disposal to manipulate the markets through DERIVATIVES (futures options) [NOTE 100% OF THE GAINS SINCE THE 2009 LOWS HAVE HAPPENED OVERNIGHT, I.E. THE PUMPED FUTURES, that's no coincidence]. They use the assets behind the U.S. Treasury to rig the prices of commodites (gold, currencies, etc.) and stocks. This fraternity comprises of Fed Chairman , the Secretary of the Treasury, and the heads of the SEC and the Commodity Futures Trading Association. It works closely with all the U.S. exchanges and Wall Street banks, including the largest DERIVATIVE risk holders Citibank and JP Morgan Chase. You see the Fed need not do the direct buying, they are lending to GS at 1/2% that you are paying 3% for. It's crooked, it's corrupt, it's classic Obama. The Fed reports a market profit at the end of the year which it returns to the Treasury, where does a profit come from if they are not trading, pepeekook?

Topic.Title: Gallup: 77% of the country says God is losing influence

Message.Msg: Okay, let's start with the fact that this message is wildly off-topic for this message board. Then there's the fact that you misquoted the headline. The poll concluded that the influence of RELIGION is declining in the US; the proportion agreeing with that is 77%. That's not the highest it's ever been, but it's higher than it's been recently. Then there's a question: Why revert to this sort of nonsense? Hasn't osso buffo been a rousing success at turning around people's perception of the state of putrefaction of Microsoft? Apparently not. I'd say the bot has failed completely.

Topic.Title: Microsoft Leads the World in Two of Six IPTV Market Categories (Source Bloomberg)....

Message.Msg: you have very negative way of agreeing. also you don't specify if this is worldwide or regional ranking. and maybe things have changed since last quarter: MRG is the only company to track and rank IPTV vendors for each of the six product categories, and has been doing so for many years. "Key findings from this study include: Vendors that ranked first globally in each product category are: Alcatel-Lucent in Access, Harmonic in VHE, Microsoft in VoD and Middleware, Google/Motorola in Set-Top Boxes and Verimatrix in CP/DRM. In addition to also being global leaders, Verimatrix leads the Content Protection category in four of the six geographic regions, Alcatel-Lucent leads in the Access category in four regions, and Harmonic, is atop the Video Headend category in two regions. Huawei leads in three of the six product categories in the Asia Pacific and is gaining traction in Middle East/Africa — most of the changes taking place in leadership for the IPTV market are happening in these regions. In North America, Google-Motorola is the winner, leading in three categories." So now they lead in two categories, huh? :-D
